title: HR Business Partner - 18 month contract
content:
Contract Length: 18 months
Start Date: November/December 2023
Our mission at Zynga is to connect the world through games by building games around core social experiences to deliver deep player engagement, organic acquisition and long term retention. Our portfolio of games include – CSR Racing 2, FarmVille, Hit it Rich! Slots, Words With Friends and Zynga Poker.
NaturalMotion Games, a Zynga studio, is hiring for a HR Business Partner to support our teams based in the UK and Ireland.  At NaturalMotion, we make games that wow people. We innovate to create experiences that previously were impossible and that would not exist without us. We take pride in making titles that reach a large audience and in creating communities that last. For the past five years, NaturalMotion Studios have been named one of the Best Places to Work in the UK games industry by gamesindustry.biz.
Job Purpose
We are seeking a HR Business Partner on a fixed term contract, to cover maternity leave. Within this role you will support teams based in the UK and Ireland, including coaching and advising our team working on our upcoming game, Star Wars: Hunters™.  
You will work with our People Operations teams across NaturalMotion, Zynga and our parent company, Take-Two.  To effectively deliver HR initiatives within your business areas including Total Rewards, Learning & Development, Diversity, Equity & Inclusion.
Develop and drive people plans across the employee lifecycle, to meet changing business needs, whilst supporting the achievement of our overall business objectives.
Key Roles & Responsibilities


Build a thorough understanding of our teams and overall business operations, as well as HR strategies and initiatives, to develop people plans that support the overall business goals


Partner with creative and technical teams on HR strategies and initiatives to enhance performance and organisational effectiveness


Drive consistent talent and compensation review within your business areas, to maintain talent health and accelerate development


Work with our L&D COE to address the training needs of the business. Ensure employee records and data are updated in Workday


Run reports from Workday as needed to aid in business decisions


Drive consistent talent and compensation review routines within your business areas


Partner with the Employee Relations team on employee issues


Partner with local and global HRBPs on strategic projects and programs


Proactively work with client groups and HR leadership to propose and drive new HR initiatives that align with business needs


Resolve and anticipate complex issues that impact multiple teams across related HR areas, employee relations or other employee issues


Required Skills & Experience 


Experience working as a HRBP, supporting employees in the UK and Ireland. Working with and supporting business teams with demonstrated results


Able to own and drive HR work, translating global initiatives into local projects


Strong client partner, with business acumen


Operated in a matrixed, fast-paced, global and rapidly-changing business environment


Deep experience of partnering with dynamic and creative teams and business leaders, able to demonstrate results though people projects


A strong solutions focus, ability to quickly identify problems and drive appropriate solutions


Able to assess the needs of a team and provide relevant solutions


Great communication skills. An excellent connector, who collaborates and always keeps the broader team in mind


Ability to work effectively in an environment with a high level of ambiguity


Desirable Skills & Experience 


Previous experience working as a HRBP in the games or entertainment industry


Experience working for a public company


CIPD qualified or relevant HR qualification


 
What do we offer?

Competitive salary
Create next-gen games that will be played and loved by millions of players around the world
Work in a family-oriented, collaborative team that invests in your development and growth on-the-job
A diverse team of friendly, fun and supportive co-workers
Flexible working hours & crunch-free working culture
Communal music and laid-back atmosphere
Summer/Christmas parties and Happy Hour in the studio each Friday
Paid holiday
Pension plan with a double matching employer contribution (capped at 8%)
Private medical insurance, dental insurance and healthcare cash plan
Life insurance, accident insurance and long-term disability insurance
Fitness Reimbursement plan worth £600 per annum
Charitable Giving Platform to which the Company contributes a 2:1

As part of our Diversity and Inclusion Strategy we would like to collect demographic information from job candidates to identify and implement strategies to understand and improve equal opportunity for all at Zynga. Completion of this information is entirely voluntary and any details you provide will not be considered in the hiring process. Zynga will anonymize demographic information for reporting and analytics to gain a better understanding of our hiring process. This  information will only be used internally within Zynga and stored securely on our systems.  

For Zynga’s full privacy notice, click here for US Job Applicant privacy notice and here for the Outside of the US Job Applicant Privacy Notice . You can email Privacy@zynga.com for more information regarding the collections and use of your data.
